title: Restructure React (Vite) frontend into pages/components/sections without UI changes

requirements.text:
Restructure the frontend source tree to match the requested organization by moving existing components (no logic/style/content changes):
- Create `frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx`
- Create `frontend/src/components/` and move `Navbar` and `Footer` into it
- Create `frontend/src/sections/` and move the existing section components into it: `Hero`, `About`, `Services`, `Works`, `GetCode`, `Contact`
- Move any shared marketing-only components used by sections (e.g., `MotionHeading`, `MotionReveal`, `CodeBlockWithCopy`, `scroll` utility) into an appropriate place under `frontend/src/components/` so imports remain clean and build passes
- Update all import paths affected by file moves

quotes:
Restructure my existing React (Vite) frontend into a clean structure without changing UI or behavior.

Create this structure:
- src/pages/HomePage.tsx
- src/components (Navbar, Footer, shared UI)
- src/sections (Hero, About, Services, Works, GetCode, Contact)

Do not change any styles, animations, or content.
Do not use Next.js.
Keep all section IDs and smooth scroll working.
Output updated file contents.

acceptanceCriteria: Existing section components are relocated into `frontend/src/sections/` and still export the same default components with identical JSX, styles, animations, and content.
`Navbar` and `Footer` are relocated under `frontend/src/components/` with no UI/behavior changes.

Any shared helper/components currently under `frontend/src/components/marketing/` that are imported by sections (e.g., `MotionHeading`, `MotionReveal`, `CodeBlockWithCopy`, `scroll`) are moved under `frontend/src/components/` (or an appropriate subfolder) and all consuming imports are updated accordingly.
Frontend builds successfully after the restructure (no missing module/import errors).

requirements.text: Create `frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx` that renders the section components in this exact order: Hero → About → Services → Works → GetCode → Contact. Ensure it renders only composition/layout and does not alter section markup, props, content, styling, or animations.

quotes:
Create HomePage.tsx that renders sections in this order:
Hero → About → Services → Works → GetCode → Contact

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx` exists and exports a React component.
`HomePage` renders the existing sections in the exact order: Hero, About, Services, Works, GetCode, Contact.
No visual/behavioral changes occur within sections as a result of using `HomePage` (only imports/composition change).

requirements.text:
Update `frontend/src/App.tsx` to render exactly:
- `<Navbar />`
- `<HomePage />`
- `<Footer />`
while preserving the existing wrapper structure/classes (e.g., the current dark background wrapper) and without changing UI/behavior.

quotes:
Update App.tsx to render:
<Navbar />
<HomePage />
<Footer />

Do not change any styles, animations, or content.

acceptanceCriteria: `App.tsx` renders `<Navbar />`, then `<HomePage />`, then `<Footer />` within the same top-level wrapper/classes currently used.
The rendered UI matches the pre-refactor UI (no content/styling/animation changes).

requirements.text: Preserve all section IDs and smooth-scroll navigation behavior after the refactor. Ensure `Navbar` navigation continues to scroll smoothly to `home`, `about`, `services`, `works`, `get-code`, and `contact` and that focus management still works.

quotes: Keep all section IDs and smooth scroll working.

acceptanceCriteria: Each section still renders with the same `id` attribute values as before (e.g., `id="home"`, `id="about"`, `id="services"`, `id="works"`, `id="get-code"`, `id="contact"`).
`Navbar` item clicks still call the same scrolling utility and result in smooth scrolling (unless user prefers reduced motion) with the same offset behavior.
After scrolling, the destination section receives focus as before (accessibility behavior preserved).

requirements.text: Provide updated file contents for all modified and newly created frontend files affected by this restructure (including `App.tsx`, `pages/HomePage.tsx`, moved `Navbar`/`Footer`, moved sections, and any moved shared components/utilities) so the refactor can be applied directly.
acceptanceCriteria: The output includes full updated contents for every file that changes path or content as part of the refactor (not just diffs).
All updated contents reflect import path changes required by the new folder structure.
No unintended text/content changes are introduced in the moved components beyond import path updates.

constraints: Do not change UI, styling, animations, layout, or content; only move files and update imports/composition.
Preserve all section IDs and existing smooth-scroll behavior.

Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, and anything under `frontend/src/components/ui`.
Backend is out of scope for this request.
nonGoals: Adding new features, pages, or content.
Changing Tailwind theme tokens, CSS variables, or animation timings.
Refactoring component logic beyond what is required to update imports/paths.
Introducing new routing libraries or frameworks (including Next.js).
